case_title: JAVAID RIZVI vs GOVERNMENT OF BALUCHISTAN Through Services And General Administration Department And Another
respondant: Government of Baluchistan Through Services And General Administration Department And Another

accussed_details.name: Javaid Rizvi
accussed_details.designation: Executive Engineer, Communication and Works Department
allegation: Payments made without proper reinforcement in cement concrete block walls causing cracks and loss of Rs.3,75,134.30
Use of substandard cement, sand, and Bajri below required specifications
Failure to conduct 10% test checking of construction work, leading to payments worth Rs.40,05,940 without proper verification
Improper recording of measurements in six running bills
Failure to hand over list of works in hand, causing loss of Rs.31,49,103 due to non-renewal of bank guarantee

complaint_summary: The appellant was accused of negligence and misconduct in overseeing the construction of the Provincial Assembly building, leading to financial losses and structural defects.
investigation_summary: The appellant was issued a show-cause notice under Rule 5 of the Baluchistan Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1983. The investigation revealed procedural lapses and alleged negligence, but evidence was insufficient to substantiate the charges.
judgment_summary: The tribunal found that the charges against the appellant were unsubstantiated due to lack of evidence and procedural irregularities in the disciplinary process. The appellant was reinstated with all back benefits.
punishment: Reinstatement with all back benefits; dismissal order set aside.
legal_arguments: No provision for horizontal and vertical reinforcement in the construction agreement.
Structural defects attributed to environmental exposure and actions of successor.
Consultants were solely responsible for quality checks under the contract.
Discriminatory treatment compared to other officers involved in the project.
statutes: Baluchistan Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1983
sections: Rule 5 of Baluchistan Civil Servants (Efficiency and Discipline) Rules, 1983
key_issues: Responsibility for structural defects and financial losses
Discriminatory treatment of officers involved in the project

legal_terms.Show-cause notice: A formal notice requiring an individual to explain or justify their actions.
legal_terms.Disciplinary proceedings: Legal process to address alleged misconduct or negligence.

words_and_phrases.Bank guarantee: A financial assurance provided by a bank to ensure obligations are met.
words_and_phrases.Structural defects: Flaws in construction affecting stability and integrity.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around allegations of negligence and misconduct against Javaid Rizvi in overseeing the construction of the Provincial Assembly building. The tribunal found procedural irregularities in the disciplinary process and insufficient evidence to substantiate the charges. The appellant was reinstated with all back benefits, and the dismissal order was set aside.

charges.charge_1: Payments made to contractor without provision for horizontal or vertical reinforcement, causing cracks and loss of Rs.3,75,134.30.
charges.charge_2: Use of cement concrete blocks below required specifications, causing alleged defects.
charges.charge_3: Failure to exercise 10% test checking, leading to payments worth Rs.40,05,940 without proper checks.
charges.charge_4: Measurements recorded in contravention of B&R Code.
charges.charge_5: Failure to hand over list of works in hand, causing loss of Rs.31,49,103 due to non-renewal of bank guarantee.

findings.charge_1: No provision in contract for horizontal or vertical reinforcement; charge dismissed.
findings.charge_2: Structure demolished before testing; appellant not responsible for quality checks; charge dismissed.
findings.charge_3: Consultants solely responsible for quality and quantity checks; charge dismissed.
findings.charge_5: Bank guarantee extended during appellant's tenure; charge dismissed.

key_points.disciplinary_procedure: Show-cause notice issued without thorough inquiry or evidence recording.
key_points.discrimination: Sub-Divisional Officer reinstated despite greater responsibility; appellant treated unfairly.
key_points.appeal_decision: Order of removal from service set aside; appellant reinstated with back benefits.
